Jx.List

Manage a list of DOM elements and provide an API and events for managing those items within a container.  Works with Jx.Selection to manage selection of items in the list.  You have two options for managing selections.  The first, and default, option is to specify select: true in the constructor options and any of the Jx.Selection options as well.  This will create a default Jx.Selection object to manage selections.  The second option is to pass a Jx.Selection object as the third constructor argument.  This allows sharing selection between multiple lists.

Example

var list = new Jx.List('container',{
  hover: true,
  select: true,
  onSelect: function(el) {
    alert(el.get('html'));
  }
});
list.add(new Element('li', {html:'1'}));
list.add(new Element('li', {html:'2'}));
list.add(new Element('li', {html:'3'}));

Events

addfired when an item is added
removefired when an item is removed
mouseenterfired when the user mouses over an element
mouseleavefired when the user mouses out of an element
selectfired when an item is selected
unselectfired when an item is selected

Summary
Jx.ListManage a list of DOM elements and provide an API and events for managing those items within a container.
Constructor
Jx.Listcreate a new instance of Jx.List
Properties
containerthe element that will contain items as they are added
selectionJx.Selection a selection object if selection is enabled
Options
itemsan array of items to add to the list right away
hover{Boolean} default false.
hoverClassthe CSS class name to add to the wrapper element when the mouse is over an item
press{Boolean} default false.
pressedClassthe CSS class name to add to the wrapper element when the mouse is down on an item
select{Boolean} default false.
Functions
addadd an item to the list of items at the specified position
removeremove an item from the list of items
replacereplace one item with another
indexOffind the index of an item in the list
countreturns the number of items in the list
itemsreturns an array of the items in the list
eachapplies the supplied function to each item
selectselect an item
unselectunselect an item or items
selectedreturns the selected item or items
emptyclears all of the items from the list
setSelectionsets the Jx.Selection object that this list will use for selection events.

Constructor

Jx.List

create a new instance of Jx.List

Parameters

container{Mixed} an element reference or id of an element that will contain the items in the list
options{Object} an object containing optional parameters
selection{Jx.Selection} null or a Jx.Selection object.  If the select option is set to true, then list will use this selection object to track selections or create its own if no selection object is supplied.

Properties

container

the element that will contain items as they are added

selection

Jx.Selection a selection object if selection is enabled

Options

items

an array of items to add to the list right away

hover

{Boolean} default false.  If set to true, the wrapper element will obtain the defined hoverClass if set and mouseenter/mouseleave events will be emitted when the user hovers over and out of elements

hoverClass

the CSS class name to add to the wrapper element when the mouse is over an item

press

{Boolean} default false.  If set to true, the wrapper element will obtain the defined pressClass if set and mousedown/mouseup events will be emitted when the user clicks on elements

pressedClass

the CSS class name to add to the wrapper element when the mouse is down on an item

select

{Boolean} default false.  If set to true, the wrapper element will obtain the defined selectClass if set and select/unselect events will be emitted when items are selected and unselected.  For other selection objects, see Jx.Selection

Functions

add

add: function(item,
position)

add an item to the list of items at the specified position

Parameters

item{mixed} the object to add, a DOM element or an object that provides a getElement method.  An array of items may also be provided.  All items are inserted sequentially at the indicated position.
position{mixed} optional, the position to add the element, either an integer position in the list or another item to place this item after

remove

remove: function(item)

remove an item from the list of items

Parameters

item{mixed} the item to remove or the index of the item to remove.  An array of items may also be provided.

Returns

{mixed} the item that was removed or null if the item is not a member of this list.

replace

replace: function(item,
withItem)

replace one item with another

Parameters

item{mixed} the item to replace or the index of the item to replace
withItem{mixed} the object, DOM element, Jx.Object or an object implementing getElement to add

Returns

{mixed} the item that was removed

indexOf

indexOf: function(item)

find the index of an item in the list

Parameters

item{mixed} the object, DOM element, Jx.Object or an object implementing getElement to find the index of

Returns

{integer} the position of the item or -1 if not found

count

count: function()

returns the number of items in the list

items

items: function()

returns an array of the items in the list

each

each: function(f,
context)

applies the supplied function to each item

Parameters

func{function} the function to apply, it will receive the item and index of the item as parameters
context{object} the context to execute the function in, null by default.

select

select: function(item)

select an item

Parameters

item{mixed} the object to select, a DOM element, a Jx.Object, or an object that provides a getElement method.  An array of items may also be provided.

unselect

unselect: function(item,
force)

unselect an item or items

Parameters

item{mixed} the object to select, a DOM element, a Jx.Object, or an object that provides a getElement method.  An array of elements may also be provided.
force{Boolean} force deselection even if this violates the minimum selection constraint (used internally when removing items)

selected

selected: function()

returns the selected item or items

Returns

{mixed} the selected item or an array of selected items

empty

empty: function()

clears all of the items from the list

setSelection

setSelection: function(selection)

sets the Jx.Selection object that this list will use for selection events.

Parameters

{Jx.Selection} the selection object, or null to remove it.

Manage selection of objects.

withItem)

context)

select an item

force)
unselect an item or items

returns the selected item or items

clears all of the items from the list

sets the Jx.Selection object that this list will use for selection events.
